form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Stabenow (for herself and Mr. Peters) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 to add certain medium-duty and heavy-duty vehicles to the advanced technology vehicles manufacturing incentive program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Building Better Trucks Act.

section.header: Advanced technology vehicles manufacturing incentive program
section.text: Section 136 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 (42 U.S.C. 17013) is amended—

clause.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (C) as clauses (i) through (iii), respectively, and indenting appropriately;
by striking (1) Advanced technology vehicle.— and all that follows through meets— and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: The term advanced technology vehicle means—

subparagraph.text: a light duty vehicle that meets—

clause.text: in subparagraph (B)(iii) (as so redesignated), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: a medium-duty or heavy-duty vehicle that—

subclause.text: is subject to regulations established by the Secretary of Transportation under parts 523, 534, and 535 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations); or
is included in a vehicle type or class that offers opportunities to substantially reduce consumption of conventional motor fuel, as determined by the Secretary by rule; and

clause.text: reduces consumption of conventional motor fuel by 10 percent or greater as compared to model year 2010 medium- and heavy-duty vehicles of a similar vehicle type or class, unless the Secretary determines by rule that—

subclause.text: the percentage is not achievable for a specific vehicle type or class; and
an alternative percentage for that vehicle type or class will result in substantial reductions in motor fuel consumption within the United States.

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (4) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: The term qualifying components means components, systems, or groups of subsystems that the Secretary determines—

subparagraph.text: to be designed to improve fuel economy or otherwise substantially reduce consumption of conventional motor fuel; or
to contribute measurably to the overall improved fuel use of an advanced technology vehicle.

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting or other vehicle after ultra efficient vehicle;
by striking subsection (f) and inserting the following:
The Secretary shall charge a closing fee of 50 basis points of the loan to cover applicable administrative expenses.

subparagraph.text: be deposited by the Secretary into the general fund of the Treasury; and
remain available until expended, subject to such other conditions as are contained in annual appropriations Acts.

paragraph.text: in subsection (h)(1)(B), by striking automobiles, or components of automobiles and inserting automobiles or other vehicles, or components of automobiles or other vehicles.
